 WOLF SG-4 (my weekend with Michael, Amanda, Lexa and Tom)


My weekend with MICHAEL, AMANDA, TOM and LEXA!

WARNING: THIS MAY BE A LONG POST
Oh my god I have just had an amazing weekend! I went to the Wolf SG-4 convention in London where Michael Shanks, Amanda Tapping and Lexa Doig were booked to attend as guests. It cost a fair bit but I thought -hey it's only my measly student loan- I can live on bread and water until my next loan cheque comes through!

My housemate and I didn?t finish until 5 on Friday so we had to get one of the last trains down to London. We got to London and then had to take the tube out to Heathrow airport and then a taxi to the hotel. I felt like we were in that Planes Trains and Automobiles film. So we eventually arrived at our hotel at midnight exhausted. The Heathrow Park where the convention was held had overbooked so we had to stay next door at the Sheriton. I am sooo glad that that happened because the Sheriton is much nicer.

We registered at 8am the next day and there were already loads of people about- why do British people love queuing so much????? The cocktail party had taken place the night before but only for the 1st 250 people - we were like 322 and 323- DARN!!!

When we finally got into the hall at 9.30 they did an opening ceremony. Lexa Doig was first on stage - in case anyone doesn?t know she is on Andromeda and is also Michael Shanks girlfriend. It was her first appearance and she was lovely. Then the biggie?.. Amanda Tapping and Michael Shanks came onto the stage holding hands (how sweet!!!). Everyone erupted into applause and cheers and they both looked really embarrassed. Amanda is really beautiful in real life and such a nice friendly person.

I've got to say now that Michael Shanks is an amazing actor. If he can be totally believable as Daniel when he is so different then I take my hat off to him. Great guy and about 100 times better looking than Daniel (who I thought was gorgeous in the first place) What a fab sense of humour too!!! As you can tell?I've got myself a slight crush now.

Then the organisers announced a special guest and guess who walked out?Tom McBeath. Yes Colonel Maybourne himself. MS and AT looked surprised that he was there and they all hugged.

After the opening ceremony the guests went out to do some of the photo sessions ( which at ?20 per photo were a little out of range of my student budget) so those still in the hall watched the Babylon 5 legend of the rangers movie which was quite good.

Then Amanda came on for her talk and boy is she great. Such a funny and genuine lady (who seems to have a thing about talking in a British accent) She answered loads of questions and told some funny stories about behind the scenes. I cant remember all of them but there were some about 'blue jello' and about her black widow syndrome! She also talked about MS leaving and almost cried on a number of times. She also told about a scene that was cut from Meridian that shen thinks shouldn't have been cut. She wanted it in because it was a scene with CJ who she wants more scenes with! Apparently after she has been to see Daniel at his bed there was supposed to be a scene where she walks out just as Teal'c is walking into the room. They were supposed to just pass in the corridor and exchange sad looks but she and CJ wanted more so they filmed it as she walks up to Teal'c and just rests her head on his chest crying as he hugs her!!!!! WHO WOULD'VE LIKE TO HAVE KEPT THAT SCENE IN??????????????? She also said that any tears you see in that episode were real!

When Lexa's talk came around she was great but obviously people wanted to know about Michael a lot. I did learn that she is a cat lover and even has cat paw prints tatoo. Apparently she wants 40 cats but Michael said only two!- Oh yeah and she tap danced for us.

Then Tom McBeath came on and he just seemed overwhelmed for the applause he got and all of the questions to him. My friend was made up- Maybourne is her favourite character! Tom came across as a great intelligent man and gave a great insight into being a recurring character and coming into the series for a few shows a year. He want to come back next season but doesn't know anything yet.

Then cam Michael. What a guy! Leather jacket and all dressed in black ! Grrrr! I hope my photos turn out! He was also sporting a little goatee and some funky sideburns which people were commenting on! He was answering loads of questions about Daniel and his departure. He seems really sad that he had left and also said that he was supposed to be talking to the people at Stargate when he got back to Canada. But said that it would only be if the role was there for a purpose and not just an appearance. But he said that he does want to go back and guest star!

Then I don?t know what came over me. I asked for the microphone and stood up infront of a thousand people to talk to Michael. Stupid me, the first words to come out of my mouth were: "Michael, I love the new facial hair!" D'oh!!!!!!! Oh well, he bowed to me and laughed so?aaaggghh I have been bowed to by Michael Shanks! I asked him a question then about the padded cell scene in Legacy. What a lovely man!!!!

He told a really funny story about the scene in Bane where Chris Judge soaked him with the gun. It wasn?t scripted at all and that scene shown is the first take- so Michaels reaction is real. He then told about getting his own back on Chris with bears who CJ is scared of. The most touching answer is when someone asked whether he had taken anything from the set when he left and he said he had taken some glasses and a uniform and 5 years of good times and memories-- AWWWWW! I'm almost crying now typing this!

After all of the talks it was Autograph time. We were the last people to get ours signed on the first day but the actors were still so nice after 4 hours of signing. I got large photos of AT and MS signed for myself and one of Lexa. Then I bought the SG-1 companion book and the author Thomasina Gibson was there signing them (all of the profits were to be donated for charity). So I have a signed copy of the book be the Author, MS, AT and Tom McBeath!

Gosh this is a long post? longer than most of my Uni essays !

That night it was the fancy dress. My friend and I had been busy all week so the only costume we could do was take out labcoats from Uni and go as SGC doctors. We had SGC badges on and the like! Arriving at the party the fancy dress competition was already on so we sat and watched that being judged by all of the guests. The costumes were great. The winner was amazingly dressed as Nem!- We were quite drunk at that time having drank a bottle of Martini neat between the two of us!. Whilst there was a break the organisers showed a montage of Daniel scens including loads from MERIDIAN. Amanda and Michael hadn't seen the episode yet so they were watching it. Amanda had her hand on Michaels shoulder the whole time. The clips were to that really sad Kate Winslett song: What if? So it was really sad. At then end a caption came up saying thanks for 5 great years Michael. I burst into tears at that point- like most of the audience because I looked over and both Michael and Amanda were crying ( their strong friendship is really evident!). It was soooo sad.

After the competition my friend and I had out photo taken rather drunkenly infront of the 'working stargate' which was way cool! Then party time and more copious amounts of alcohol followed by dancing!

We got to bed at about 2am and then got back up again at 6am this morning to be ready for the second day. The queue was longer today than yesterday! But we managed to get good aisle seats with a nice view!!! They showed Meridian first which set me off crying again- I looked around and there were people crying everywhere again!. Michael came on and did his talk again as did Amanda Tom and Lexa. They were running behind schedule today so the talks were shorter but still really funny!

Whilst we were waiting for the schedule to catch up we watched another video (which I shouldn't really tell you I watched because its only just out at the cinema - here's a hint: there were hobbits in it)!

Then the auction was done as it has been also done on the Saturday. There were some way cool items. One woman paid ?800 pounds for the original set of the blueprints for the Stargate and another paid ?600 for the Osiris jar used in the episode The Curse. Michael and Amanda also came on stage and auctioned items of their costumes which were going for tremendous amounts of money.

I cant believe what a good time I had. If anyone wants to know more let me know and I will tell you all but am too tired now. Its just taken another 6 hours to get home to Liverpool and I've been typing this out for an hour now. Oh my god Ive been up for about 21 hours straight? I'm rambling now!

I thought you knew about the convention President Doc! I am sure I mentioned it to you when we were chatting on MSM one day!

Oh well. I am going to put my photos in for developing tomorrow and I will try and get them and the autographed stuff scanned in so that I can show you the photos. I hope my camera turns out. it was playing up a bit- oh well even if it doesn't I can watch the video when it arrives!

I've got loads more stuff to say but I don't know how long you lot want me to ramble. I cant believe how much I rambled on in my post last night. I think I had reached the giddy lack of sleep stage!

I am sooooo tired today. I just want to sleep but I have got Yoga at six and then Taekwondo training at seven thirty!
